instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2877: What is 820-2877? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off because of backlight circuit
threads.message:
hi, this is my first post at the forum, i really appreciate what you are doing here guys it helped me a lot so thank you :)
this board is for 2010 MacBook it was working fine until the screen went black as the customer said.
i checked the backlight circuit and concluded that when i disconnect the fuse the machine boots fine but with no internal screen external works fine though. replaced most of the components but still the same turning of exactly when it tries to get to the white screen or when the backlight tries to turn on.
replaced these components:
<CHIP>U9700</CHIP> 
<DIODE>D9710</DIODE> 
<TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR>
LVDS connector 
no short to ground and the resistance to ground on pins are OL on all pins except the ground pins
have no idea what to do next 
any help is appreciated
thank you
note: when i inject 12.5 volt on pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R9700</RESISTOR> <SIGNAL>PPVIN_BKL</SIGNAL> 
the <CHIP>U9700</CHIP> gets hot and burned pin 3 and 4 removed and replaced with a good chip still the same and no short to ground on the chip pins until power is injected.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off because of backlight circuit
threads.message:
Check <RESISTOR>R9715</RESISTOR>/16 then replace <CHIP>U9700</CHIP>.
Be sure <DIODE>D9710</DIODE> is not shorted A-K.
Also check continuity between <CHIP>U9700</CHIP> pins and external components.
<RESISTOR>R9730</RESISTOR> is OK?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off because of backlight circuit
threads.message:
thank you for the replay,
<RESISTOR>R9715</RESISTOR> is 1M and6 <RESISTOR>R9716</RESISTOR> is 244k
continuity is good no short to ground on <DIODE>D9710</DIODE>
<RESISTOR>R9730</RESISTOR> is 11 ohm

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> turns off because of backlight circuit
threads.message:
I asked for short A-K on <DIODE>D9710</DIODE>.
Check if ground points of <CHIP>U9700</CHIP> really have contact with MLB ground.
Double check traces and solders on <CHIP>U9700</CHIP> area.
Finally try a new chip, but do not inject voltage again.
